sen.j: 徳大寺 実維（とくだいじ さねふさ、寛永13年3月1日 (旧暦)（1636年4月6日） - 天和 (日本)2年9月11日 (旧暦)（1682年10月11日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Sanefusa TOKUDAIJI (April 6, 1636-October 11, 1682) was a high-rank Court noble in the early Edo period.
Sanefusa TOKUDAIJI (April 6, 1636-October 11, 1682) was a high-rank Court noble in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 明正天皇（109代）・後光明天皇（110代）・後西天皇（111代）・霊元天皇（112代）の四帝にわたって仕え、官位は正二位内大臣まで進む。
sen.e: He served Emperor Meisho, Emperor Gokomyo, Emperor Gosai, and Emperor Reigen in a row, and his official court rank culminated at Shonii Naidaijin (Senior Second Rank, Inner Minister).

sen.j: 父は左大臣徳大寺公信。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Kinnobu TOKUDAIJI.

sen.j: 母は長州藩主毛利秀就の養女（岩国藩主吉川広正の娘）。
sen.e: His mother was a adopted daughter of Hidenari MORI, lord of the Choshu Domain (a daughter of Hiromasa KIKKAWA, lord of the Iwakuni Domain).

sen.j: 正室は権大納言藪嗣孝の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife a daughter of Dainagon (a chief councilor of state) Tsugutaka YABU.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Tsugutaka YABU.
sen.cmt: 「was」を追記。原文の「大納言」は、ウィキでは「権大納言」になっています。「大納言」はリンク先のようです。
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Tsugutaka YABU.

sen.j: 子に徳大寺公逸・徳大寺公観、養子に内大臣徳大寺公全がいる。
sen.e: His children included Kinhashi TOKUDAIJI and Kinshime TOKUDAIJI, and his adopted son included Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kintomo TOKUDAIJI.

sen.j: 寛永14年（1637年）に叙爵して以降清華家当主として早いスピードで累進し、侍従・左近衛少将・左近衛中将を務める。
sen.e: Since 1637, when he was created an official court rank, Sanefusa was on express track of promotion as the head of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles) and held many positions, including jiju (a chamberlain), Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since 1637, when he was conferred an official court rank, Sanefusa was on the express track of promotion as the head of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles) and held many positions, including jiju (a chamberlain), Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: created を使った＆見たことがないので、「conferred」に変更しました。「express」の前に「the」を入れました。ウィキで確認すると、「近衛府・近衛府」はリンク先で、「左近衛少将・左近衛中将」が正しいようです。

sen.j: 承応2年（1653年）には従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: In 1653, he was created Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and joined the realm of kugyo (high-rank Court nobles).

sen.j: 権中納言を経て、寛文元年（1661年）に権大納言となる。
sen.e: After working as Chunagon (Middle Councillor), he was appointed as Dainagon.
After working as Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state), he was appointed as Gon Dainagon in 1661.

sen.e: After working as Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), he was appointed as Gon Dainagon in 1661.

sen.j: 寛文9年（1669年）には右近衛大将・右馬寮御監となったが、寛文10年（1670年）には辞した。
sen.e: He was assigned to Konoefu Meryo (Bureau of Horses at the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) in 1669, but he stepped down in 1670.

sen.e: He assumed the post of Naidaijin in 1671 but resigned in the following year.
